008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.ij.overlay;
010
011import java.awt.BasicStroke;
012import java.awt.Color;
013import java.awt.Font;
014import java.awt.Shape;
015import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
016
017import ij.gui.Overlay;
018import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
019import ij.gui.TextRoi;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This is an adapter for ImageJ's {@link Overlay} class to ease the insertion
024 * of AWT {@link Shape} elements. Shapes are only geometric descriptions but
025 * have no stroke width, color etc. attached. These are determined by
026 * {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter}'s <strong>current state</strong> when insertion
027 * is done with {@link #addShape(Shape)} (i.e., without explicit stroke
028 * information). Alternatively, the shape's stroke and color may be explicitly
029 * specified by calling {@link #addShape(Shape, ColoredStroke)}. When a shape is
030 * inserted into the associated overlay it is converted to an ImageJ
031 * {@link ShapeRoi} instance whose stroke/fill properties are set.
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * Similarly, text elements can be added using
035 * {@link #addText(double, double, String)} or
036 * {@link #addText(double, double, String, Font, Color)}.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * By default, shapes added to {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter} are automatically
040 * translated by 0.5 units in x/y direction, such that integer coordinates are
041 * shifted to pixel centers. This can be deactivated using constructor
042 * {@link #ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay, boolean, boolean)}.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 * <strong>Usage example 1 (adding shapes using stroke/color state):</strong>
046 * </p>
047 * <pre>
048 * ImagePlus im = ...
049 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
050 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
051 * 
052 * ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.25, Color.blue));
053 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2));
054 * ...                  // add more shapes with same stroke
055 * ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.4, Color.pink));
056 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x3, y3, x4, y4));
057 * ...                  // add more shapes with same stroke
058 * im.setOverlay(oly);
059 * im.show();
060 * </pre>
061 * <p>
062 * <strong>Usage example 2 (adding shapes with element-wise stroke/color
063 * specification):</strong>
064 * </p>
065 * <pre>
066 * ImagePlus im = ...
067 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
068 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
069 * ColoredStroke mystroke = new ColoredStroke(0.25, Color.blue);
070 * ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2), mystroke);
071 * ...                          // add more shapes
072 * im.setOverlay(oly);
073 * im.show();
074 * </pre>
075 * <p>
076 * <strong>Usage example 3 (adding text):</strong>
077 * </p>
078 * <pre>
079 * ImagePlus im = ...
080 * Overlay oly = new Overlay();
081 * ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
082 * ola.setFont(new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 8));
083 * ola.setTextColor(Color.green);
084 * ola.addText(x, y, "text using current font/color state");
085 * 
086 * ola.addText(x, y, "text with explicit font and color", new Font(Font.SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 10), Color.black);
087 * ...
088 * im.setOverlay(oly);
089 * im.show();
090 * </pre>
091 * 
092 * 
093 * @author WB
094 * @version 2022/06/09
095 * 
096 * @see ColoredStroke
097 * @see Shape
098 *
099 */
100public class ShapeOverlayAdapter {
101        
102        public static Color DefaultTextColor = Color.black;
103        public static float DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.5f;
104        public static Font DefaultFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 10);
105        
106        private static final AffineTransform PixelOffsetTransform = new AffineTransform(1, 0, 0, 1, 0.5, 0.5); // AWT transformation!
107        
108        private final boolean antiAlias;
109        private final boolean halfPixelOffset;
110        private final Overlay overlay;
111        
112        private ColoredStroke stroke;
113        private Color textColor = DefaultTextColor;
114        private Font font = DefaultFont;
115        
116
117        
118        // ----------------------------------------------------------
119        
120        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly, boolean halfPixelOffset, boolean antiAlias) {
121                this.overlay = oly;
122                this.halfPixelOffset = halfPixelOffset;
123                this.antiAlias = antiAlias;
124                this.stroke = makeDefaultStroke();
125        }
126        
127        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly) {
128                this(oly, true, true);
129        }
130        
131        public ShapeOverlayAdapter() {
132                this(new Overlay());
133        }
134        
135        // ----------------------------------------------------------
136        
137        public ColoredStroke getStroke() {
138                return stroke;
139        }
140        
141        public void setStroke(ColoredStroke stroke) {
142                this.stroke = stroke;
143        }
144        
145        public void setTextColor(Color color) {
146                this.textColor = color;
147        }
148        
149        public void setFont(Font font) {
150                this.font = font;
151        }
152        
153        public Overlay getOverlay() {
154                return this.overlay;
155        }
156        
157        // ----------------------------------------------------------
158        
159        protected ShapeRoi shapeToRoi(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
160                s = (halfPixelOffset) ? PixelOffsetTransform.createTransformedShape(s) : s;
161                ShapeRoi roi = new ShapeRoi(s);
162                BasicStroke bs = stroke.getBasicStroke();
163                roi.setStrokeWidth(bs.getLineWidth());
164                roi.setStrokeColor(stroke.getStrokeColor());
165                roi.setFillColor(stroke.getFillColor());
166                roi.setStroke(bs);
167                roi.setAntiAlias(antiAlias);
168                return roi;
169        }
170        
171        public void addShape(Shape s) {
172                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, this.stroke));
173        }
174        
175        public void addShapes(Shape[] shapes) {
176                for (Shape s : shapes) {
177                        overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, this.stroke));
178                }
179        }
180        
181        public void addShape(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
182                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, stroke));
183        }
184        
185        public void addShapes(Shape[] shapes, ColoredStroke stroke) {
186                for (Shape s : shapes) {
187                        overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, stroke));
188                }
189        }
190        
191        // TODO: check font/color settings
192        public void addText(double x, double y, String text) {
193                TextRoi troi = new TextRoi(x, y, text, this.font);
194                troi.setStrokeColor(this.textColor);
195                overlay.add(troi);
196        }
197        
198        public void addText(double x, double y, String text, Font font, Color textColor) {
199                TextRoi troi = new TextRoi(x, y, text, font);
200                troi.setStrokeColor(textColor);
201                overlay.add(troi);
202        }
203
204        // ----------------------------------------------------------
205        
206        private static ColoredStroke makeDefaultStroke() {
207                ColoredStroke stroke = new ColoredStroke();
208                stroke.setLineWidth(DefaultStrokeWidth);
209                stroke.setStrokeColor(DefaultTextColor);
210                return stroke;
211        }
212
213}
